intro: Campylotropis speciosa subsp. speciosa, commonly known as the showy campylotropis, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits within the broader Campylotropis genus.
